result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam Lee Giese was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $543 costs to be paid to Clerk of Courts by 5-12-2016.
Complete AODA and all treatment/counseling as necessary.
Complete AODA and all treatment/counseling as necessary.
No contact directly or indirectly with victim, B.N.S., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere.

Must complete Domestic Violence Intervention Program.
Any treatment/counseling as deemed necessary.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Adam Lee Giese in court with attorney Matthew Lantta.  Scott Henry Dirks appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No contest plea to count 1, Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 dismissed and read in.  Sentence withheld, Court orders 2 years probation with conditions:  AODA, DVIP, any treatment deemed necessary; $543 costs due by 5-12-2016; no contact with victim; 2 days sentence credit if revoked.

Defendant Adam L. Giese in court with attorney Matthew Lantta.  Scott Henry Dirks appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 11:00 am.  Jury selection scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Adam L. Giese in court in custody with attorney Matthew Lantta.  Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to Defendant, penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Defendant stands mute, not guilty plea entered by court, jury trial to be set.
No contact directly or indirectly with victim, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Absolute sobriety.
